eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.engine.weights

Class Estimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.engine.weights.Estimator

  • public class Estimator
extends Object
    Estimates a data-driven weight per queryable attribute if not specified by the user.

    • Field Summary

      private Map<String,Double> estWeights 
      private double sumWeights

    • Field Detail

        private Map<String,List<Double>> attrScores

        private Map<String,Double> estWeights

        private double sumWeights

    • Constructor Detail

      • Estimator

        public Estimator()
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • setInput

        public void setInput(String task,
                     List<Double> scores)
        Specifies the input data (scores) to be analyzed for estimating weight for a given attribute.
        Parameters:
        task - The identifier of the task (priority queue collecting candidate entities most similar in the given attribute).
        scores - A list of the scores for all candidate entities.

      • getStatistics

        public Map<String,Double> getStatistics(String task)
        Calculate statistics over the scores of the candidate entities collected on the specified attribute (priority queue)
        Parameters:
        task - The identifier of the priority queue collecting candidates on a queryable attribute.
        Returns:
        The collection of statistics (min, max, avg, count) over the collected similarity scores.

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        Validates whether internal structure can be used for weight estimation.
        Returns:
        True, if weight estimation can be applied; otherwise, False.

      • setMissingWeight

        public void setMissingWeight(String task)
        Specifies that a weight is missing for the given task (representing an attribute) and must be estimated.
        Parameters:
        task - The task identifier of the priority queue used for a queryable attribute.

      • hasMissingWeight

        public boolean hasMissingWeight(String task)
        Indicates whether weight(s) are missing for the given attribute and must be estimated.
        Parameters:
        task - The identifier of the task (priority queue collecting candidate entities most similar in the given attribute).
        Returns:
        True, if no weight was specified for this attribute; otherwise, False.

      • test

        public void test()
        Auxiliary method that sets all estimated weights to 1.0. CAUTION: The assigned value must be subsequently normalized (done in the getWeights method).

      • proc

        public void proc()
        Estimates a weight per requested attribute. Simplified estimation based on standard deviations of the input values (scores).

      • proc

        public void proc(int k)
        Estimates a weight per requested attribute. Assigned weight is the p-th percentile of the input values (scores per attribute).
        Parameters:
        k - The k-th item in the input ordered by descending score.

      • getSumWeights

        private double getSumWeights()
        Sums up the estimated weights for all attributes with no user-specified weights. CAUTION! Any attributes with user-specified weights are excluded from estimation.
        Returns:
        The sum of all estimated weights.

      • getAttributesWithoutWeight

        public List<String> getAttributesWithoutWeight()
        Provides the attributes where weight estimation will be applied.
        Returns:
        A collection of attribute names.

      • getWeights

        public Map<String,Double[]> getWeights(int numCombinations)
        Provides the final estimated weights per attribute; only applied for attributes with missing weight(s).
        Parameters:
        numCombinations - The number of weight combinations per attribute.
        Returns:
        Estimated weights per attributes to be applied in issuing the query results.

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight(String task)
        Provides the estimated weight for the given task identifier (i.e., this corresponds to a queryable attribute).
        Parameters:
        task - The identifier of the task (priority queue collecting candidate entities most similar in the given attribute).
        Returns:
        A double value representing the estimated weight.
